intro: Amana anhuiensis, commonly known as the Anhui amana, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Anhui Province in China. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amana anhuiensis is considered a vulnerable species.
